sect1.title: How the System Administration Volumes Are Organized
sect1.para: Here is a list of the topics that are covered by the volumes of the System Administration Guides.

entry.para: User accounts and groups, server and client support, shutting down and booting a system, managing services, and managing software (packages and patches)
Printing services, terminals and modems, system resources (disk quotas, accounting, and crontabs), system processes, and troubleshooting Solaris software problems

olink.citetitle: System Administration Guide: Devices and File Systems

entry.para: Removable media, disks and devices, file systems, and backing up and restoring data
TCP/IP network administration, IPv4 and IPv6 address administration, DHCP, IPsec, IKE, Solaris IP filter, Mobile IP, IP network multipathing (IPMP), and IPQoS

olink.citetitle: System Administration Guide: Naming and Directory Services (DNS, NIS, and LDAP)

entry.para: DNS, NIS, and LDAP naming and directory services, including transitioning from NIS to LDAP and transitioning from NIS+ to LDAP

olink.citetitle: System Administration Guide: Naming and Directory Services (NIS+)

entry.para: Web cache servers, time-related services, network file systems (NFS and Autofs), mail, SLP, and PPP
Auditing, device management, file security, BART, Kerberos services, PAM, Solaris cryptographic framework, privileges, RBAC, SASL, and Solaris Secure Shell

olink.citetitle: System Administration Guide: Solaris Containers-Resource Management and Solaris Zones

entry.para: Resource management topics projects and tasks, extended accounting, resource controls, fair share scheduler (FSS), physical memory control using the resource capping daemon (rcapd), and dynamic resource pools; virtualization using Solaris Zones software partitioning technology
